top_categories.workout_context: Coast to Coast’s 204-mile distance demands power production deep into fatigue — the defining challenge of ultra-distance gravel.
At 204 miles, Coast to Coast rewards a massive aerobic engine. This volume work builds the fat-oxidation capacity that keeps you moving when glycogen runs low.
Every session at Coast to Coast intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Coast to Coast’s gravel roads, rural michigan demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Coast to Coast isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Coast to Coast’s michigan gravel roads delivers on race day.
Coast to Coast rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Coast to Coast’s michigan gravel roads and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Coast to Coast when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Tempo is the race-day intensity of Coast to Coast. Harder than Z2, easier than threshold — the pace you’ll hold for hours on michigan gravel roads.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Coast to Coast. Make this intensity feel like home.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Coast to Coast — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.

race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 204 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 204 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Coast to Coast requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on michigan gravel roads to build confidence. Expect: gravel roads, rural michigan, rolling terrain.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, HVLI Extended, and Endurance to prepare you for 204 miles of michigan gravel roads in Au Gres to Ludington, Michigan.
